workflow.name: Classify & extract data from floorplans with Mistral AI OCR & JigsawStack
workflow.description:
üåä What it Does

This workflow automatically classifies uploaded files (PDFs or images) as floorplans or non‚Äëfloorplans. It filters out junk files, then analyzes valid floorplans to extract room sizes and measurements.

üë• Who it‚Äôs For

Built for real estate platforms, property managers, and automation builders who need a trustworthy way to detect invalid uploads while quickly turning true floorplans into structured, reusable data.

‚öôÔ∏è How it Works

  1. User uploads a file (PDF, JPG, PNG, etc.).
  2. Workflow routes the file based on type for specialized processing.
  3. A two‚Äëlayer quality check is applied using heuristics and AI classification.
  4. A confidence score determines if the file is a valid floorplan.
  5. Valid floorplans are passed to a powerful OCR/AI for deep analysis.
  6. Results are returned as JSON and a user-friendly HTML table.

üß† The Technology Behind the Demo

This MVP is a glimpse into a more advanced commercial system. It runs on a custom n8n workflow that leverages Mistral AI's latest OCR technology. Here‚Äôs what makes it powerful:

  • Structured Data Extraction: The AI is forced to return data in a clean, predictable JSON Schema. This isn't just text scraping; it‚Äôs a reliable data pipeline.
  • Intelligent Data Enrichment: The workflow doesn't just extract data‚Äîit enriches it. A custom script automatically calculates crucial metrics like wall surface area from the floor dimensions, even using fallback estimates if needed.
  • Automated Aggregation: It goes beyond individual rooms by automatically calculating totals per floor level and per room type, providing immediate, actionable insights.

While this demo shows the core classification and measurement (Step 1), the full commercial version includes Step 2 & 3 (Automated Offer Generation), currently in use by a client in the construction industry.

Test the Live MVP

üìã Requirements

  • Jigsaw Stack API Key
  • n8n Instance
  • Webhook Endpoint

üé® Customization

Adjust thresholds, fine‚Äëtune heuristics, or swap OCR providers to better match your business needs and downstream integrations.

parameters.content:
## üö´ Low Quality / Drop

**When:** Confidence < 0.4 or unclear image

**Response:**
- Tell user file isn't a floorplan
- Suggest uploading blueprint/CAD
- List acceptable formats (JPG, PNG, PDF)

**User sees:** "Unable to Process Your Floorplan"

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Manual Review Needed

**When:** Confidence 0.4-0.85 (uncertain)

**Response:**
- File needs human check
- Promise 2-hour turnaround
- Set expectation for email follow-up

**User sees:** "Manual Review Required"

## ‚úÖ Continue to Step 2

**When:** Confidence ‚â• 0.85 (from text analysis)

**Response:**
- Confirm successful validation
- Explain next steps (OCR/measurement)
- Set 30-60 second expectation

**User sees:** "Floorplan Accepted!"

*Continues to Jigsaw OCR*

## Image Classification

**When:** Image files with high AI confidence

**Response:**
- Premium quality detected
- Instant processing message
- List what's being calculated

**User sees:** "Perfect Quality Floorplan"

*Fast track to measurements*

## üìä Flow Summary

**PDF Path:**
Extract text ‚Üí Score confidence ‚Üí Route by threshold

**Image Path:**
Direct to AI classification ‚Üí Route by result

**Thresholds:**
- < 40%: Not a floorplan
- 40-85%: Manual review
- ‚â• 85%: Auto-process

**Goal:** Filter bad uploads early, save API costs

## üìè File Size/Pages Limit

**When:**
- File > 10MB
- PDF > 20 pages

**Response:**
- Explain size limits
- Ask to split multi‚Äëfloor plans
- Suggest extracting relevant pages

**User sees:** "File Too Large"

# üè† Floorplan Classifier & Measurement Extractor  

## ‚úÖ What This Workflow Does  

Automatically validates uploaded files (**PDFs or images**) to check if they are genuine floorplans. It rejects non‚Äëfloorplans early, and prepares valid files for **room measurement & analysis**.  

The workflow has **two phases**:  
1. **Classification (Step 1):** Smart filters & classifiers decide if the upload is usable.  
2. **Calculation (Step 2):** OCR + AI extract structured room measurements (area + wall surfaces) and compile results.  

---

### Supported File Types  
- **PDFs** ‚Üí text is extracted for keyword/measurement checks, then passed to AI.  
- **Images (JPG, PNG, etc.)** ‚Üí sent directly to the classifier (can‚Äôt extract metadata text).  

---

### Quality Filtering (Step 1)  
1. **Heuristic checks** ‚Üí detects floorplan indicators:  
   - Room names (living room, keuken, slaapkamer, etc.)  
   - Measurements (m¬≤, mm)  
   - Technical symbols (e.g., WCD, TH, WP).  
2. **AI classification (JigsawStack)** ‚Üí robustly decides floorplan vs. not.  

---

### Confidence Routing (Step 1)  
- **< 40% confidence** ‚Üí ‚ùå Rejected (not a floorplan).  
- **40‚Äì85% confidence** ‚Üí ‚ö†Ô∏è Unclear ‚Üí ask for better upload/manual review.  
- **> 85% confidence** ‚Üí ‚úÖ Accepted floorplan ‚Üí sent to **Measurement Extraction (Step 2)**.  

---

### Measurement Extraction (Paid version ONLY)  
---

## ‚öí Requirements  
- **JigsawStack API key** ‚Üí File storage + classification  
- **Mistral Cloud API key** ‚Üí OCR measurement extraction  
- **n8n instance** ‚Üí Self‚Äëhosted or Cloud  
- **Webhook endpoint** ‚Üí for uploads & responses  

---

## üîß Customization  
- Adjust **heuristic rules** (keywords/symbols) to match your market.  
- Change **confidence thresholds** (strict vs. lenient filtering).  
- Set **wall height** or fallback ratio for wall area calculations.  
- Choose your OCR/AI provider (Mistral, AWS Textract, Azure Vision, etc.).  
- Extend workflows to **save results to DB, Notion, Slack, CRM**.  

---

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Notes  
- Never hardcode API keys ‚Üí use **n8n credential manager**.  
- All nodes are **renamed by purpose** (easy to follow).  
- Sticky Notes document both phases clearly.  
- Designed as **plug‚Äëand‚Äëplay end‚Äëto‚Äëend pipeline** for fast onboarding.

user.name: Stephan Koning
user.bio: Account Executive by day , Noco builder for fun at night and always a proud dad of Togo the Samoyed.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
